title: Student-Led Computing Task Design: Societal Domain-Tailored Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental Computer Literacy and General Understanding of Social Issues
context.additional_context: Learners are novice-level students with diverse backgrounds (interest in medical/legal/technical fields) who perform project-based assessments in an online environment using digital devices.

learning_goals: Learners can compare three or more alternative approaches in the design process of computing-based solutions for social issues.
Learners can autonomously select and perform computing tasks linked to their professional domains (medical/legal/technical).
Learners can systematically manage and present team project documents using collaboration tools (with 85% or higher task completion rate).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
